page.title: 16CROSTON CHARACTERS
page.content: {Mr.Richard Hough,Rectory Farm,Croston {4 generations}of Houghs have farmed here, in the centre of Croston.In 1942 when he took over the farm the first tractor cost Â£98;now they cost Â£6000. Then there were{98 acres}of land all around the farm; since then most of this land has been{sold for building and now most of the 130 acres is on the moss. His 2 brothers work on the farm but his and their{children}have other jobs and{won't be taking over the farm. {David Caunce}is 21 and has just gained a degree at Manchester{University}in Mathematics and a post as a trainee {accountant}in Preston.He enjoyed life at{Bishop Rawstorne High School}and later at Runshaw 6th Form College at Leyland.He likes village life and enjoys having a social drink at the pub and taking part in sport.
